Island¶

The MapIsland module¶

class biosim.MapIsland.Map_Island(island_geo, init_pop)[source]¶

A class for the island

Initialize map class with given island geography and initial population of the various cells.

Parameters

  • island_geo (multiline str) – Specifies island geography

  • init_pop (list of dicts) – Specifies initial population of each cell

add_population(population)[source]¶

Creates a dictionary with the new population. Next the dictionary is added to the map dictionary

Parameters

population (list of dicts) – Specifies the new population of one or more cells

check_for_equal_map_lines()[source]¶

This is a function that checks that all the lines in the map’s geography string have equal length.

check_island_boundaries()[source]¶

This is a function that raises an error if the boundary cells are not water.

create_geography_dict()[source]¶

Converts geography string to a dictionary with coordinates as keys and the landscape types as values. Coordinates are a tuple of x and y coordinates.

create_map_dict()[source]¶

Iterates through geography dictionary and creates a new dictionary of the entire map. This dict has coordinates as keys and instances of landscape classes as values. Each landscape instance has the population list of it’s coordinate as input. :raise ValueError: if invalid landscape type is given in geography string

create_population_dict()[source]¶

Converts list of populations to a population dictionary that has coordinates as keys and lists of the properties of the animals at this location as values.

neighbours_of_current_cell(current_coordinates)[source]¶

Finds all neighbouring coordinates of a given cell. Checks the landscape type of each coordinate. The neighbour switch landscape types an animal can move to, are returned. :param current_coordinates: Location of current cell :type current_coordinates: tuple :return: list of neighbour cells :rtype: list

year_cycle()[source]¶

simulates one year

Runs through each of the 6 yearly seasons for all cells. - Step 1: Animals feed - Step 2: Animals procreate - Step 3: Animals migrate - Step 4: Animals age - Step 5: Animals lose weight - Step 6: Animals die

biosim
